sentences.en: And in later life these same children manifest conservation, domineering, rigid and prejudiced attitudes.
sentences.cn: 而在日后的生活中,这些儿童就表现出保守的 、 跋扈的 、 强硬的和有偏见的态度.

sentences.en: Because of anxiety and worry, I'm often headstrong and domineering.
sentences.cn: 由于焦虑和担心, 我经常任性和霸道.

sentences.en: But they knew also the Chairman's domineering temper and tenacity.
sentences.cn: 可是他们也知道董事长的脾气就是那样专断,那样执拗.

sentences.en: However, we can sometimes turn and become overbearing and domineering.
sentences.cn: 然而, 有时我们也会过分依赖主导功能,变得过于傲慢自大.

sentences.en: It is said that once upon a time there was a girl who was unusually domineering.
sentences.cn: 听说在很久以前,有位姑娘脾气很坏,总是盛气凌人.

sentences.en: Ji eliminate child, said: Not yet, still looking sharp and domineering.
sentences.cn: 纪消子说: 还不行, 还是目光犀利,盛气凌人.

sentences.en: Mick was stubborn and domineering with a very bad temper.
sentences.cn: 米克既固执又专横，脾气还很坏。

sentences.en: On the other hand your Pisces mate may leave if you become too domineering.
sentences.cn: 另一方面,如果你过于骄横跋扈,双鱼座的伙伴是会离你而去的.

sentences.en: She has at last come into her own since her domineering sister left home.
sentences.cn: 自从她那指手划脚的姐姐离开家庭之后,她终于可以自己作主了.

sentences.en: She said you were domineering and rude.
So, in the long run, do those that rely on domineering leader.
sentences.cn: 但长远来看, 那些一人独揽大权的公司下场其实也是如此.

sentences.en: Suggestions of domineering ministers sometimes affect the emperor's decisions.
sentences.cn: 权臣的提议有时会影响皇帝的决定.

sentences.en: That domineering manner of yours cuts no ice here with me.
sentences.cn: 你那种盛气凌人的态度在这里对我不起作用.

sentences.en: This blueprint is aggressive and domineering, as Microsoft and HP are.
sentences.cn: 与微软和惠普不约而同的是,这份蓝图同样霸气四溢.

sentences.en: Whatever they do, they want an active role and are frequently perceived as domineering.
sentences.cn: 无论她们做什么, 她们想成为积极的角色,并经常被认作主角.

words.tran_cn: 女性施虐狂；专横的女人；假装规矩而实际上提供性服务的女人
实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 刚愎自用、喜欢支配别人的，专横跋扈的，盛气凌人的
trans.tran_en: someone who is domineering tries to control other people without considering their feelings or ideas – used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）
